item.title: Reduced Spoke Bicycles : Conceptual Bike
item.description:
Reduced Spoke Bicycles : Conceptual Bike

Conceptual Bike - Ion Lucin has simplified the design of a standard two-wheeler with his conceptual bike Baik that opts for three-spoked wheels, a limited use of lin...

item.title: The Great Barrier Reef's Best Hope Is a Killer Robot
item.description:
The Great Barrier Reef's Best Hope Is a Killer Robot

Crown-of-thorns starfish are the zombies of the sea. They won't die even if you cut them in half. To kill one, you must dismember it completely-or inject it with poisonous (to them) bile salts. Instead of braaains, these zombies munch coral, and off the coast of Australia, infestations of the beasts are damaging the Great Barrier Reef at an alarming rate.

item.title: Photos of Various Food Dishes Flying Through the Air
item.description:
Photos of Various Food Dishes Flying Through the Air

Camden, London-based commercial still life photographer Piotr Gregorczyk likes to play with food and gravity. One concept he has focused on for a number of recent projects is the idea of showing various food dishes flying through the air as they come together on a plate or in a bowl.

item.title: Why Tesla Will Destroy the Automobile Industry
item.description:
Why Tesla Will Destroy the Automobile Industry

If there's an example of a company about to disruptively innovate an entire industry, it's Tesla. Partly, this is because of raw technology--Tesla's is clearly superior to that of its competitors. Partly, it's because Tesla has a more efficient business model. As Slate recently pointed out, Tesla bypasses value-subtracting dealer franchises and universally disliked car salespeople.

item.title: Grand Café de Tropen, Amsterdam, Netherlands
item.description:
Grand Café de Tropen, Amsterdam, Netherlands

To be frank, Amsterdam's Koninklijk Instituut voor de Tropen, more informally known as the Royal Tropical Institute, is not the first place you'd think of for a lunch of pulled chicken marinated in hoi-sin and star anise. The stately Dutch Gothic Revival pile was designed by J.J.
